Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania have kept clean sheets in three of their last four matches, showcasing strong defensive form.
Cyprus have failed to win a competitive away match since 2019, losing 14 out of their last 17 such encounters.
Both teams have struggled to score, with Cyprus averaging just 0.4 goals per game in their Euro 2024 qualification campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lithuania’s improvement in defence has been a significant factor in their recent successes.
Cyprus’ attacking woes suggest that we are unlikely to see a high-scoring match.
Both sides will be aware of their limitations and may prioritise avoiding defeat over chasing a win at all costs.
Others: The upcoming UEFA Nations League clash between Lithuania and Cyprus offers an intriguing contest as both sides seek to avoid relegation in Group C2.

Lithuania, under Edgaras Jankauskas, are riding a wave of steady form after a respectable Euro 2024 qualifying campaign, while Cyprus find themselves under increasing pressure following a dismal run in recent international competitions.
Given the current dynamics between these two teams, the prediction of under 2.5 goals is the most likely outcome.
The prediction of a 1-0 scoreline also mirrors Cyprus’ tendency to keep things relatively close in matches where they have been the underdogs.
